clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Arterial Tonometry Sensor With Standard Oscillometric Blood Pressure Monitoring Device
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Arterial Tonometry Sensor (BPro) With Standard Oscillometric Blood Pressure Monitoring Device (Oscar 2) for Ambulatory Use

collaborator.agency: Comisión Nacional de Investigación Científica y Tecnológica

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims at comparing the values of the blood pressure measurements obtained during 24 hours by an arterial tonometry device (BPRo) and a standard oscillometric blood pressure monitoring device (Oscar 2) under ambulatory conditions

detailed_description.textblock: The study aims at comparing the values of the blood pressure measurements obtained during 24 hours by an arterial tonometry device (BPRo) and a standard oscillometric blood pressure monitoring device (Oscar 2) under ambulatory conditions. Measurements will be taken at 15 minutes intervals during the day and 30 minutes intervals during the night.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in systolic blood pressure taken simultaneously by BPro and Oscar 2 devices
primary_outcome.description: Mean of the absolute differences in systolic blood pressure (mmHg) taken simultaneously by BPro and Oscar 2 devices at 15 minutes intervals during the day and 30 minutes intervals during the night for a period of 24 hours

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in diastolic blood pressure taken simultaneously by BPro and Oscar 2 devices
primary_outcome.description: Mean of the absolute differences in diastolic blood pressure (mmHg) taken simultaneously by BPro and Oscar 2 devices at 15 minutes intervals during the day and 30 minutes intervals during the night for a period of 24 hours

arm_group.description: Blood pressure measurement with BPro and Oscar 2 simultaneously during 24 hours under ambulatory conditions

intervention.description: BPro and Oscar 2 comparison for 24 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Difference in blood pressure between the arms higher than 10 mmHg

facility.name: Institute for Biological and Medical Engineering
